tn.text: The abstract noun "investigation" can be expressed with the verbs "investigate" or "search." AT: "ordered his officials to investigate" or "ordered his officials to search" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

What they were to investigate can be stated clearly. AT: "ordered his officials to investigate the records" or "ordered his officials to search and find out if there was a record of King Cyrus telling the Jews to build the house of God in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is a building where the king's officials kept the important government records.
This is the name of a city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This can be stated in active form. AT: "they found a scroll" or "they found a scroll that told about Darius and Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This begins the record of King Cyrus's command that the Jews rebuild God's temple in Jerusalem.

tn.ref: In the first year of King Cyrus
tn.text: It can be stated clearly that this is the first year of his reign. AT: "In year 1 of the reign of King Cyrus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let the Jews rebuild the house" or "The Jews must rebuild the house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"60 cubits." You may convert this to a modern measure. AT: "twenty-seven meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: with three rows of large stones and a row of new timber
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) this describes how to build the foundation. AT: "Build it on three layers of large stones covered with one layer of timber" or 2) this describes how to build the walls. AT: "Built its walls with three layers of large stones alternating with one layer of timber"

tn.ref: let the cost be paid by the king's house
tn.text: The phrase "the king's house" represents King Cyrus's own wealth in the royal treasury. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will pay for it with money from the royal treasury" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This continues the record of King Cyrus's command that the Jews rebuild God's temple in Jerusalem, which began in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:06:03|6:3]].
Darius writes directly to these men. Translate their names as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:03|5:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:09|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This continues the record of King Cyrus's command that the Jews rebuild God's temple in Jerusalem, which began in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:06:03|6:3]].

tn.ref: Funds from the king's tribute beyond the River will be used to pay these men
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Use funds from the kings tribute beyond the river to pay these men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Funds from the king's tribute beyond the River
tn.text: "The king's tribute" refers to taxes that people pay the king. AT: "Money from the taxes that you collect for the king from the people beyond the river"
This can be translated in active form. AT: "Whatever they need" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This continues the record of King Cyrus's command that the Jews rebuild God's temple in Jerusalem, which began in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:06:03|6:3]].

tn.ref: a beam must be pulled from his house and he must be impaled on it. His house must then be turned into a rubbish heap
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I command my officials to pull a beam from his house and impale him on it. They are then to turn his house into a rubbish heap" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
a long, sturdy piece of wood, supporting the roof of a house
pierced through

tn.ref: who lifts a hand to change ... or to destroy
tn.text: Lifting the hand represents trying or daring to do something. AT: "who tries to change ... or to destroy"  or "who dares to change ... or to destroy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The abstract noun "decree" can be expressed with the phrase "what I have decreed." AT: "to change what I have decreed" or "to say that I have decreed something else" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Translate the names of these men as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:03|5:03]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This can be translated in active form. You may need to make explicit which house they completed. AT: "They completed God's house" or "They finished building the temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the third day of the month of Adar
tn.text: "Adar" is the name of the twelfth and last month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the cold season. The third day is near the middle of February on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
King Darius had been ruling for five years, so he was now in year number six of his reign. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

These people had been captured and taken to Babylon, but they returned to Jerusalem. AT: "the rest of the people who been taken captive to Babylon and had returned to Jerusalem " or "the rest of the people who had returned from captivity"

tn.ref: one hundred bulls ... four hundred lambs
tn.text: "100 bulls ... 400 lambs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: assigned the priests and Levites to work divisions
tn.text: The abstract noun "work divisions" can be expressed with the phrase "divide into work groups." AT: "divided the priests and levites into work groups"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"groups that work together"

tn.ref: fourteenth day of the first month
tn.text: This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The fourteenth day is near the beginning of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"made themselves pure." Being pure represents being acceptable to God. AT: "made themselves acceptable to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: separated themselves from the uncleanness of the people of the land
tn.text: Separating themselves from uncleanness represents refusing to do things that make people unclean. AT: "They refused to do the things that the people of the land did that made them unclean" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the uncleanness of the people of the land
tn.text: Here "uncleanness" represents being unacceptable to God. AT: "the things that the people of the land did that made them unacceptable to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Seeking Yahweh represents choosing to know, worship, and obey him. AT: "chose to obey Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: turned the heart of Assyria's king
tn.text: Turning the king's heart represents making him think differently about the work of the temple. AT: "changed the attitude of Assyria's king" or "made Assyria's king willing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: to strengthen their hands in the work of his house
tn.text: Strengthening their hands in the work represents helping them to work. The Assyrian king did this by telling them to do the work and providing the money for it. AT: "to help them do the work of his house" or "to make it possible for the to do the work of his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to building the temple.
